title: [HELP] Patch 4.21 has broken the game client/patcher. RIOT, please respond so I can play.
body:
Well, it seems to be official. Patch 4.21 has snapped my league client in half. As of yesterday, I was able to play, no problem. However, today I tried to start league and it doesn't work at all - it opens the logo for a second, the logo disappears, it reappears with a bar underneath it (like it was going to patch), then disappears. 

Looking at the task manager, I can see that lolpatcher and RADS kernel started but they force close themselves after 10-15 seconds. I'm about ready to give up and start playing DOTA at this point, I have spent almost 4 hours trying to fix this using various guides.

Here's a list of what I have tried:
-Disabling firewall
-Disabling antivirus
-Replacing the RADS kernel with a new one from Riot
-Giving all permissions to league related applications
-Manually installing new ADOBE AIR and Directx 9
-Uninstalling league --> disk cleanup --> reinstalling (4 or 5 times)
-Windows updates
-Run as admin
-Disabling UAC
-Checking active scripting (it was on)
EDIT: added more above

NOTHING works at all. I have no idea what happened but this patch completely disables my ability to play. What's really weird is that I only have lol patcher and lol launcher subfolders in my RADS project folder - not AIR client or game client files, so these aren't being downloaded by the patcher, though they should be.

I've seen several posts of this nature since 4.21 in the help and support forum. This is the first time I have ever posted on the forums, since I've never been so frustrated by LOL. Can we please get a RIOT response to this soon, since I would like to play my favorite game?

BIG EDIT: I got the game to finally work. It turns out when I changed the hosts file, I didn't change it properly (mistyped the localhost number). It seems to be working now, thank goodness.

replies.body:
1) Go to C:\Windows\system32\drivers\etc
2) Open "host" file

Make sure your localhost is 127.0.0.1

If you have anything else below that, it's the issue that is preventing the patcher from opening and closing out automatically. Just delete everything below the localhost.

> [{quoted}](name=OptimusXai,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=d4fTqYB3,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2014-12-11T02:07:53.424+0000)
> 1) Go to C:\Windows\system32\drivers\etc
> 2) Open "host" file
> 
> Make sure your localhost is 127.0.0.1
> 
> If you have anything else below that, it's the issue that is preventing the patcher from opening and closing out automatically. Just delete everything below the localhost.

What did you use to open the file?

open it with notepad ,then save it 
windows may not let you save it in the original direction ,it will offer to save in documents ,then it will save as text 
so copy the original host file to another place out of C drive 
edit it ,save it ,delete the original host ,copy the edited one back to C:\Windows\System32\drivers\etc

HUGE thanks! This finally got it to work after I tried it a second time.

It turns out when I changed the hosts file the first time, I didn't change it properly (mistyped the localhost number). It seems to be working now, thank goodness.

Mine also say this. My Mac client was working fine last night and this patch completely shut it down. I've tried all the options and nothing is working. I'm in the same boat as Kinabinzinalee above. I only have this computer and there's too much money spent on this account for the game to just stop working.

Exact same issue here.  One day it was working and the next day it won't even open.  I had some hope for a few minutes today when it hung on LolLauncher a little longer than usual but then it crashed as soon as LolPatcher got open.  Would really be nice to know that they're working on this after so many of us have poured so much into the game.

Hey guys,

not sure if this will work for you but give it a try

OS X Yosemite
Version 10.10.1

go to your MAC host file:
1. Open Terminal
2. sudo vi /private/etc/hosts
3. Make sure that 127.0.0.1 says localhost
4. Save the file and re-open League Client

(I had changed mine few months ago when I was running a local server on it but I'm guessing this patch messed something up - Thank you OptimusXai )

Now I have to wait for it to Update since I deleted it yesterday because of the stupid "Failed to resolve host:port"
it already says 127.0.0.1 localhost but stil it won't open please help me
Was your client freezing at 33 and 87 % because mine is constantly doing this. I'm repairing the files now hopefully that will work. {{summoner:4}}
Third

I Second all of this. I've done everything possible. spent all day trying to fix this.{{summoner:3}}  I don't want to lose all the money I spent on my account. This is the only computer I have and can use for league.
this worked for me, i just renamed hosts file to hostsbak and league started league and after short pause (made me sweat) it opened!
As an update, I tried the host switching and it didn't work.
maybe someone will listen to us.. been sitting here reading and trying everything i could find for the last fee hrs. nothing helps.

Hey everyone!

Please refer to [this Discussion](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/ERAqgjGs-bug-my-patcher-will-not-open-after-patch-421) for help on how to resolve this issue! There are a few steps there that can get you guys back on the Rift!

Hey guys,

It seems like there's quite a few fixes and suggestions floating around for this. I had this issue myself with a second install I have of LoL. After closing and re-opening it a few times, Windows Firewall eventually popped up and asked me do I want to allow it through. I assume something has changed with how it patches which makes all older firewall rules obsolete.

My first suggestion would be to do the same thing as above, just keep trying to launch it until, hopefully, Windows Firewall pops up as mine did. Then just allow it through the network.

If this doesn't work: if you already have LoL added to your firewall exceptions list, I advise deleting the rules and readding them.

If you don't think you use a firewall or just use the standard windows firewall, please follow these steps:

- Go to Start and search for "Windows Firewall"
- Open up Windows Firewall, and to the left select "Allow an app or feature through Windows Firewall"
- Click the "Change Settings" button at the top right here
- Scroll down and select any existing LoL rules, and "REMOVE" them
- Once complete, go to "Allow another app..." at the bottom
- In the window that pops up, go to "Browse..."
- Go to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends and add lol.launcher.exe
- Do the same with lol.launcher.admin.exe
- Do the same with C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\system\RADS_USER_KERNEL.exe

Once done, try launching LoL again, and see if it makes any difference.

I had this too and I managed to launch the launcher by starting:
Riot Games\League of Legends\RADS\projects\lol_launcher\releases\{Latest Version}\deploy\LoLLauncher.exe

Hope that works for you.

My fix was easy.

Restarted and then disabled both firewalls windows and Avast, hooked the PC straight into the modem with no router and voila.

You apparently need to restart before disabling FW.
